intro: Corydalis pauciflora var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered corydalis, is a flowering plant in the family Fumariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers with white petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or woodland habitats and prefers well-drained soil. It has slender, creeping stems and produces small, heart-shaped leaves. Corydalis pauciflora var. albiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its subtle beauty.
